trans-unit.source: Introduction to Hyper-V on Windows 10
trans-unit.target: Introduction to Hyper-V on Windows 10

trans-unit.source: Whether you are a software developer, an ITPro, or a tech enthusiast, many of you need to run multiple operating systems, occasionally on many different machines.
trans-unit.target: Whether you are a software developer, an ITPro, or a tech enthusiast, many of you need to run multiple operating systems, occasionally on many different machines.

trans-unit.source: Not all of us have access to a full suite of labs to house all these machines, and so virtualization can be a space and time saver.
trans-unit.target: Not all of us have access to a full suite of labs to house all these machines, and so virtualization can be a space and time saver.

trans-unit.source: This is a new sentence.
trans-unit.target: This is a new sentence.

trans-unit.source: hehehe
trans-unit.target: hehehe

trans-unit.source: Here is a diagram:
trans-unit.target: Here is a diagram:

trans-unit.target: <linkText>image</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Uses for virtualization
trans-unit.target: Uses for virtualization

trans-unit.source: Virtualization enables anyone to easily maintain multiple test environments consisting of many operating systems, software configurations, and hardware configurations.
trans-unit.target: Virtualization enables anyone to easily maintain multiple test environments consisting of many operating systems, software configurations, and hardware configurations.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V provides virtualization on Windows as well as a simple mechanism to quickly switch between these environments without incurring additional hardware costs.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V provides virtualization on Windows as well as a simple mechanism to quickly switch between these environments without incurring additional hardware costs.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V can be used in many ways, for example:
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V can be used in many ways, for example:

trans-unit.source: A test environment consisting of multiple virtual machines can be created on a single desktop or laptop computer.
trans-unit.target: A test environment consisting of multiple virtual machines can be created on a single desktop or laptop computer.

trans-unit.source: Once testing has completed, these virtual machines can be exported and then imported into any other Hyper-V system.
trans-unit.target: Once testing has completed, these virtual machines can be exported and then imported into any other Hyper-V system.

trans-unit.source: Developers can use Hyper-V on their computer to test software on multiple operating systems.
trans-unit.target: Developers can use Hyper-V on their computer to test software on multiple operating systems.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have an application that must be tested on Windows 8, Windows 7 and a Linux operating system, multiple virtual machines can be created on your development system, one containing each of these operating systems.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have an application that must be tested on Windows 8, Windows 7 and a Linux operating system, multiple virtual machines can be created on your development system, one containing each of these operating systems.

trans-unit.source: You can use Hyper-V to troubleshoot virtual machines from any Hyper-V deployment.
trans-unit.target: You can use Hyper-V to troubleshoot virtual machines from any Hyper-V deployment.

trans-unit.source: You can export a virtual machine from your production environment, open it on your desktop running Hyper-V, perform your required troubleshooting, and then export it back into the production environment.
trans-unit.target: You can export a virtual machine from your production environment, open it on your desktop running Hyper-V, perform your required troubleshooting, and then export it back into the production environment.

trans-unit.source: Using virtual networking, you can create a multi-machine environment for test/development/demonstration that is secure from affecting the production network.
trans-unit.target: Using virtual networking, you can create a multi-machine environment for test/development/demonstration that is secure from affecting the production network.

trans-unit.source: Enthusiasts can use it to experiment with other operating systems.
trans-unit.target: Enthusiasts can use it to experiment with other operating systems.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V makes it very easy to bring up and tear down different operating systems.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V makes it very easy to bring up and tear down different operating systems.

trans-unit.source: You can use Hyper-V on a laptop for demonstrating older versions of Windows or non-Windows operating systems.
trans-unit.target: You can use Hyper-V on a laptop for demonstrating older versions of Windows or non-Windows operating systems.

trans-unit.source: System requirements
trans-unit.target: System requirements

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V requires a 64-bit system that has Second Level Address Translation (SLAT). SLAT is a feature present in the current generation of 64-bit processors by Intel & AMD. You’ll also need a 64-bit version of Windows 8 or greater, and at least 4GB of RAM. Hyper-V does support creation of both 32-bit and 64-bit operating systems in the VMs.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V requires a 64-bit system that has Second Level Address Translation (SLAT). SLAT is a feature present in the current generation of 64-bit processors by Intel & AMD. You’ll also need a 64-bit version of Windows 8 or greater, and at least 4GB of RAM. Hyper-V does support creation of both 32-bit and 64-bit operating systems in the VMs.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V’s dynamic memory allows memory needed by the VM to be allocated and de-allocated dynamically (you specify a minimum and maximum) and share unused memory between VMs.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V’s dynamic memory allows memory needed by the VM to be allocated and de-allocated dynamically (you specify a minimum and maximum) and share unused memory between VMs.

trans-unit.source: You can run 3 or 4 VMs on a machine that has 4GB of RAM but you'll need more RAM for 5 or more VMs.
trans-unit.target: You can run 3 or 4 VMs on a machine that has 4GB of RAM but you'll need more RAM for 5 or more VMs.

trans-unit.source: On the other end of the spectrum, you can also create large VMs with 32 processors and 512GB RAM, depending on your physical hardware.
trans-unit.target: On the other end of the spectrum, you can also create large VMs with 32 processors and 512GB RAM, depending on your physical hardware.

trans-unit.source: Operating systems you can run in a virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Operating systems you can run in a virtual machine

trans-unit.source: The term "guest" refers to a virtual machine and "host" refers to the computer running the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The term "guest" refers to a virtual machine and "host" refers to the computer running the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V on Windows supports many different guest operating systems including various releases of Linux, FreeBSD and Windows.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V on Windows supports many different guest operating systems including various releases of Linux, FreeBSD and Windows.

trans-unit.source: For information about which operating systems are supported as guests in Hyper-V on Windows, see <link><linkText>Supported Windows Guest Operating Systems</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Linux and FreeBSD Virtual Machines on Hyper-V</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about which operating systems are supported as guests in Hyper-V on Windows, see <link><linkText>Supported Windows Guest Operating Systems</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Linux and FreeBSD Virtual Machines on Hyper-V</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Differences between Hyper-V on Windows and Hyper-V on Windows Server
trans-unit.target: Differences between Hyper-V on Windows and Hyper-V on Windows Server

trans-unit.source: There are some features that work differently in Hyper-V on Windows than they do Hyper-V running on Windows Server.
trans-unit.target: There are some features that work differently in Hyper-V on Windows than they do Hyper-V running on Windows Server.

trans-unit.source: These include the following:
trans-unit.target: These include the following:

trans-unit.source: The memory management model is different for Hyper-V on Windows.
trans-unit.target: The memory management model is different for Hyper-V on Windows.

trans-unit.source: On a server, Hyper-V memory is managed with the assumption that only the virtual machines are running on the server.
trans-unit.target: On a server, Hyper-V memory is managed with the assumption that only the virtual machines are running on the server.

trans-unit.source: In Hyper-V on Windows, memory is managed with the understanding most client machines are running software in addition to running virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: In Hyper-V on Windows, memory is managed with the understanding most client machines are running software in addition to running virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: For example, a developer might be running Visual Studio as well as several virtual machines on the same computer.
trans-unit.target: For example, a developer might be running Visual Studio as well as several virtual machines on the same computer.

trans-unit.source: SR-IOV on a 64-bit guest works normally, but 32-bit does not and is not supported.
trans-unit.target: SR-IOV on a 64-bit guest works normally, but 32-bit does not and is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Windows Server features not avilable in Windows Hyper-V
trans-unit.target: Windows Server features not avilable in Windows Hyper-V

trans-unit.source: There are some features included in Hyper-V on server that are not included in Hyper-V on Windows.
trans-unit.target: There are some features included in Hyper-V on server that are not included in Hyper-V on Windows.

trans-unit.source: These include the following:
trans-unit.target: These include the following:

trans-unit.source: The Remote FX capability to virtualize GPUs
trans-unit.target: The Remote FX capability to virtualize GPUs

trans-unit.source: Live migration of virtual machines from one host to another
trans-unit.target: Live migration of virtual machines from one host to another

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Replica
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Replica

trans-unit.source: Virtual Fibre Channel
trans-unit.target: Virtual Fibre Channel

trans-unit.source: SR-IOV networking
trans-unit.target: SR-IOV networking

trans-unit.source: Shared .VHDX
trans-unit.target: Shared .VHDX

trans-unit.source: Warning: Virtual machines running on Hyper-V do not automatically handle moving from a wired to a wireless connection.
trans-unit.target: Warning: Virtual machines running on Hyper-V do not automatically handle moving from a wired to a wireless connection.

trans-unit.source: You must change the virtual machines network adapter settings manually.
trans-unit.target: You must change the virtual machines network adapter settings manually.

trans-unit.source: Limitations
trans-unit.target: Limitations

trans-unit.source: Using virtualization does have limitations.
trans-unit.target: Using virtualization does have limitations.

trans-unit.source: Features or applications that depend on specific hardware will not work well in a VM.
trans-unit.target: Features or applications that depend on specific hardware will not work well in a VM.

trans-unit.source: For example, games or applications that require processing with GPUs (without providing software fallback) might not work well.
trans-unit.target: For example, games or applications that require processing with GPUs (without providing software fallback) might not work well.

trans-unit.source: Also, applications relying on sub 10ms timers, like latency-sensitive high-precision apps such as live music mixing apps, etc. could have issues running in a VM.
trans-unit.target: Also, applications relying on sub 10ms timers, like latency-sensitive high-precision apps such as live music mixing apps, etc. could have issues running in a VM.

trans-unit.source: The root OS is also running on top of the Hyper-V virtualization layer, but it is special in that it has direct access to all the hardware.
trans-unit.target: The root OS is also running on top of the Hyper-V virtualization layer, but it is special in that it has direct access to all the hardware.

trans-unit.source: This is why applications with special hardware requirements continue to work unhindered in the root OS but latency-sensitive, high-precision apps could still have issues running in the root OS.
trans-unit.target: This is why applications with special hardware requirements continue to work unhindered in the root OS but latency-sensitive, high-precision apps could still have issues running in the root OS.

trans-unit.source: As a reminder, you'll need to have a valid license for any operating systems you use in the VMs test.
trans-unit.target: As a reminder, you'll need to have a valid license for any operating systems you use in the VMs test.
